body.p:
My dear Friend, i have the parcel safe this morning. many respectable people were vexed at my not being able to get the Concert Room last night. a Mr Mason, the Town Clerk, was so delighted with my discourse on thursday as to declare he was riveted and could remain all night. a wife of one of the Dissenting Preachers declared her satisfaction at what she heard and her great disappointment in not being able to come again last night. i had a famous audience last night in the market place and sold above a dozen dictionary. t took tea with Mr Levison last night and examined his Phrenological Museum. in every sense of the word he is a first rate character. the Socialists here are treating me as i think they ought with respect. they are too weak to be a sect, and last night helped me as well as they could. i see no chance of an introduction to the Woods. on tuesday next, Crabtree is to hold a Chartist meeting, which i think will be an abortion. his manners do not suit Doncaster. mine here caught the popular taste. i have just sold four vols of Mirabaud i had with me at the low figure of a shilling a volume ; to a Bookseller ; so i think you had better send me another parcel tomorrow morning with the shirts. as i was writing thus far, the bookseller came to say he would take all i had got at that price – so i'll let him have them ; but he is about to leave the town and wants them tomorrow. the same coach [[2]] comes tomorrow, leaving Sheffield at nine. i have now resolved on stopping sunday here and of preaching in the Market-Place tomorrow. i fear i shall not yet find Fleming at Leeds. the Mr Aldam writing from Crowle is a Draper. the one you see is a Farmer near Mansfield but they are all of the same stamp, prime fellows (their Socialism excepted). you will understand that i want all the Mirabaud. there is an imperfect copy i took back from Lingard Lettered different from the others. you need not send that. you will see it socked[?]. i know you will be pleased with this trouble. my stock of money is but 1,,13,,0. i must not reduce it yet as i have a vill here to pay ; but i hope to send a little on monday. Levison himself is astonished at my Scripture Interpretations and says i ought to print a neat Synopsis of them for personal sale. they will excite the country yet ; not withstanding all its devilisms and demeaners[?]. on whatever he lectures at Sheffield, he will be worth your notice. he is likely to report my appearance her in the Iris. the Doncaster Papers (both) say nothing. if i find the Woods here on tuesday, taking part in the Chartist Meeting, i will take part with them. i should like you to get and put a Moral World in my parcel tomorrow. you or someday can have a bit of music and song for it. i have enquired and it does not come here till wednesday. have Faith my good friend – have Hope – Charity you have in abundance. Faith, Hope and Charity are blessed qualifications in this wicked world. all that the Doncaster Religious Folks can [[3]] say to me is to ask how it is i am the only wise man on the subject of religion in the country i answer that it is for them to find out that : to find out as i have done how they have been misled. i pity the stolidity of the Materialists who cannot see my present course to be the more useful and more effectual. bigotry is universal ; it belongs to every sect and party. be you a Catholic Christian. i have not time to fill up my sheet – But this i know will make sunday a little pleasanter to you. i shall most probably write again on monad. love to Mrs Turton and Jane, Mary Anna and husband. respectfully richard carlile
i am very happy in Doncaster –
